definition: lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate

sentences.english: Our Prime Minister is unwearied to work for people.
sentences.chinese: 我們的總理孜孜不倦地爲人民工作。

sentences.english: Conquering its challenges has become the quest of Chinese engineers.
sentences.chinese: 征服所有挑戰已經成了中國工程師們孜孜的追求。

sentences.english: They were still driving away at the encyclopaedia.
sentences.chinese: 他們仍在孜孜不倦地編寫那部百科全書。

sentences.english: This bourn is the one that many serious authors go in for.
sentences.chinese: 這是古今中外許多嚴肅的藝術家孜孜以求的藝術境界。

sentences.english: He perseveres in his work makes us shame.
sentences.chinese: 他孜孜不倦的幹勁使我們大家慚愧。

sentences.english: Refine fine goods for people is the company' s persevering pursue.
sentences.chinese: 精製良品爲萬民是公司孜孜不倦的追求。

sentences.english: She persevered with her violin lessons.
sentences.chinese: 她孜孜不倦地學習小提琴。

sentences.english: A harmonious society is an ideal for which mankind has been searching indefatigably.
sentences.chinese: 和諧社會是人類孜孜以求的理想目標。

sentences.english: Laughter is indifferent to everything in life to pursue diligently.
sentences.chinese: 笑對人生是淡泊一切的孜孜追求。

sentences.english: Harmonious the society is perseveringly the ideal society that Chinese people's several thousand in the last yearses pursue.
sentences.chinese: 和諧社會是中國人民數千年來孜孜追求的理想社會。

sentences.english: UTMOST: BHAIUA men always pursue utmost high serving quality.
sentences.chinese: 卓越的服務品質一直是力量威人所孜孜追求的目標。

sentences.english: The satisfaction of customers is always our permanent pursuit.
sentences.chinese: “客戶的滿意”永遠是我們孜孜追求的目標。

sentences.english: The scientists persevered with their experiments until they succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 科學家孜孜不倦地進行試驗，直到取得成功。

sentences.english: LuoXiaoChun tirelessly to propose to gu buildings, and finally succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 駱曉春孜孜不倦地向顧阡陌求婚，終於獲得了成功。

sentences.english: To build a better future is the long-cherished dream of mankind.
sentences.chinese: 建設一個更加美好社會，是人類孜孜以求的理想。

sentences.english: It was her diligently strive after the attainment of.
sentences.chinese: 那是她孜孜以求的正果。

definition: to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
to work from morning to night (idiom)
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
expert craft from hard practice (idiom); hard-won skill/A masterpiece demands suffering.
to search for sth/to seek/to quest/to explore
to dress before light and not eat before dark (idiom)/diligently attending to official matters
to make a living by writing/to write (as an author)
